main event: Ground radar and visual observation of a peanut-sized object in Hamilton, Ohio on 4th July 1957, lasting 10-15 minutes, with comments suggesting consistency with missile firings from the area.
interesting points: The UFO was detected both on ground radar and visually, confirming its existence.
The object was described as the size of a peanut at arm's length, emphasizing its small and unusual nature.
Comments on the observation suggested a potential link to missile firings from the area, raising questions about its origin.
The sighting lasted for 10-15 minutes, allowing for a sustained observation of the mysterious object.
The irregular course of the object adds to the intrigue and unusual nature of the sighting.
result: potentially explained as consistent with missile technology testing from the area
sighted object: a peanut-sized object detected on the ground radar and visually
